title: snowflake.snowpark.DataFrame.drop | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
Returns a new DataFrame that excludes the columns with the specified names
from the output.

This is functionally equivalent to calling select() and passing in all
columns except the ones to exclude. This is a no-op if schema does not contain
the given column name(s).

*cols – the columns to exclude, as str, Column or a list
of those.

SnowparkClientException – if the resulting DataFrame
    contains no output columns.
